author: Special Correspondent
text:
Aavin has opened five more wi-fi enabled ice cream parlours in the city —Photo: Special Arrangement

In an effort to connect with the younger generation, Aavin has opened five more wi-fi enabled ice cream parlours in the city. At the parlours, situated in prominent locations, customers can make their own combinations of ice cream scoops and toppings.

The high-tech outlets that have come up near Ashok Nagar Pillar, Besant Nagar bus terminus, Vannanthurai market and in Thiruvanmiyur on LB Road beyond Jayanthi Theatre signal, have seating arrangements and TV sets.

Besant Nagar resident G. Ramakrishnan said: “A lot of people visited the outlet on Sunday. It is nice to see an Aavin parlour maintained well with good service,” he said.

Like Aavin’s first hi-tech parlour at Virugambakkam, these parlours too have snacks including cutlets, pizzas, burgers and French fries. T. Geetha, another resident, suggested that the parlours could also have chaat items in the evenings. The parlours have been constructed at a total cost of Rs. 2.43 crore.
title: Surf while enjoying your scoop
